metadata.dc:author: Martín-Cuartero, Joaquín
Hernando-Almudí, Ernesto
Vallejo-Bernad, Cristina
Sánchez-Rubio, María
Casamayor-Franco, Carmen
Cerdán-Pascual, Rafael
metadata.dc:description: BACKGROUND Intestinal malrotation is a congenital anomaly of the intestinal rotation and fixation, and usually occurs in the neonatal age. OBJECTIVE Description of a clinical case associated with acute occlusive symptoms. CLINICAL CASE A case of intestinal malrotation is presented in a previously asymptomatic woman of 46 years old with an intestinal obstruction, with radiology and surgical findings showing an absence of intestinal rotation. CONCLUSIONS Intestinal malrotation in adults is often asymptomatic, and is diagnosed as a casual finding during a radiological examination performed for other reasons. Infrequently, it can be diagnosed in adults, associated with an acute abdomen.
metadata.dc:subject: Malrotación intestinal
Obstrucción intestinal
Vólvulo intestinal
Intestinal obstruction
Intestinal malrotation
Intestinal volvulus
metadata.dc:title: Malrotación intestinal en adulto asociada a vólvulo intestinal.
[Adult intestinal malrotation associated with intestinal volvulus].
